hooks.prompt: A skill is about to be executed. Check if the skill is 'build-presentation' or 'preview-presentation'. If it is, first check if a scripts/ directory exists in the current presentation directory. If scripts/ exists and contains any .js or .py files, run all scripts in that directory using the appropriate interpreter (node for .js, python for .py) BEFORE proceeding with the build. If scripts run successfully, continue with the original command. If scripts fail, warn the user but still proceed with the build. Be brief - just mention 'Running presentation scripts...' when executing them.

A file was just modified. Check if the file is named 'content.md' in a presentation directory (has images/, data/, scripts/ folders). If it is a presentation's content.md file and the user has autoBuild enabled in their settings (.claude/presentation-creator.local.md), automatically rebuild the presentation by running the equivalent of /build-presentation. If autoBuild is not enabled or this is not a presentation directory, do nothing. Be silent about this check - only speak if you're rebuilding the presentation.

Check if the current directory contains a presentation (has content.md, images/, data/ folders). If it does, briefly mention that presentation-creator plugin is available and list the available commands: /create-presentation, /build-presentation, /validate-presentation, /preview-presentation. Keep this message very brief (1-2 lines). If not a presentation directory, say nothing about this plugin.
